feed.title: Current Watches, Warnings and Advisories for New Zealand issued by MetService

entry.title: Heavy Rain Warning - Orange
entry.summary: Expect a further 20 to 30 mm of rain on top of what has already fallen, though possibly more in localised places. Peaks rates of 15 to 25 mm/h, but 25 to 40 mm/h possible in localised downpours. Impact: Streams and rivers may rise rapidly. Surface flooding, slips, and difficult driving conditions possible. Chance of upgrading to a Red Warning: Low. Changes: Separated out Auckland.

author.name: Meteorological Service of New Zealand Limited

entry.title: Heavy Rain Warning - Orange
entry.summary: Expect a further 30 to 50 mm of rain on top of what has already fallen, though possibly more in localised places. Peaks rates of 15 to 25 mm/h, but 25 to 40 mm/h possible in localised downpours. Impact: Streams and rivers may rise rapidly. Surface flooding, slips, and difficult driving conditions possible. Chance of upgrading to a Red Warning: Low. Changes: Separated out Northland and extended period until 1am Wednesday.

author.name: Meteorological Service of New Zealand Limited

entry.title: Heavy Rain Warning - Orange
entry.summary: Expect a further 50 to 80 mm of rain on top of what has already fallen, but possibly more in localised places. Peak rates of 15 to 25 mm/h, but possibly 25 to 40 mm/h in localised downpours. Impact: Streams and rivers may rise rapidly. Surface flooding, slips, and difficult driving conditions possible. Chance of upgrading to a Red Warning: Low. Changes: Updated event in progress.

author.name: Meteorological Service of New Zealand Limited

entry.title: Heavy Rain Warning - Orange
entry.summary: Expect a further 80 to 120 mm of rain on top of what has already fallen, mainly inland. Peak rates of 15 to 25 mm/h, but 25 to 40 mm/h possible in localised downpours. Impact: Streams and rivers may rise rapidly. Surface flooding, slips, and difficult driving conditions possible. Chance of upgrading to a Red Warning: Moderate. Changes: Split Bay of Plenty warning at Kawerau as area to the east has a longer validity period than the west.

author.name: Meteorological Service of New Zealand Limited

entry.title: Heavy Rain Warning - Orange
entry.summary: Expect a further 100 to 140 mm of rain on top of what has already fallen, mainly inland. Peak rates of 15 to 25 mm/h, but 25 to 40mm/h possible in localised downpours . Impact: Streams and rivers may rise rapidly. Surface flooding, slips, and difficult driving conditions possible. Chance of upgrading to a Red Warning: Moderate. Changes: Split Bay of Plenty warning at Kawerau as area to the east has a much longer validity period than the west.

author.name: Meteorological Service of New Zealand Limited

entry.title: Heavy Rain Warning - Orange
entry.summary: Expect 80 to 120 mm of rain, especially north of Ruatoria, possibly more in localised places. Peak rates of 15 to 25 mm/h expected but possibly 25 to 40 mm/h in localised downpours. Impact: Streams and rivers may rise rapidly. Surface flooding, slips, and difficult driving conditions possible. Chance of upgrading to a Red Warning: Low. Changes: Watch upgraded to an Orange Warning.

author.name: Meteorological Service of New Zealand Limited

entry.title: Heavy Rain Warning - Orange
entry.summary: Expect 70 to 100 mm of rain on top of what has already fallen. Peak rates of 10 to 20 mm/h. Impact: Streams and rivers may rise rapidly. Surface flooding, slips, and difficult driving conditions possible. Chance of upgrading to a Red Warning: Low. Changes: Warning period extended from 4am to 9am Wednesday.

author.name: Meteorological Service of New Zealand Limited

entry.title: Heavy Rain Warning - Orange
entry.summary: Expect a further 70 to 100 mm of rain on top of what has already fallen. Intensities may reach 15 to 25 mm per hour. Impact: Streams and rivers may rise rapidly. Surface flooding, slips, and difficult driving conditions possible. Chance of upgrading to a Red Warning: Minimal. Changes: Updated event in progress.

author.name: Meteorological Service of New Zealand Limited

entry.title: Heavy Rain Warning - Orange
entry.summary: Expect a further 20 to 30 mm on top of what has already fallen. Rainfall intensities may reach 10 to 15 mm per hour. Impact: Streams and rivers may rise rapidly. Surface flooding, slips, and difficult driving conditions possible. Chance of upgrading to a Red Warning: Minimal. Changes: The chance of upgrade for the Orange Warning has been decreased to Minimal.

entry.title: Heavy Rain Warning - Orange
entry.summary: Expect a further 30 to 50 mm of rain on top of what has already fallen, especially in the ranges. Rainfall intensities of 10 to 20 mm per hour are possible. Impact: Streams and rivers may rise rapidly. Surface flooding, slips, and difficult driving conditions possible. Chance of upgrading to a Red Warning: Low. Changes: Updated event in progress.

author.name: Meteorological Service of New Zealand Limited

entry.title: Heavy Rain Warning - Orange
entry.summary: Expect a further 20 to 40 mm of rain on top of what has already fallen, particularly about the Gordon and Richmond Range. Peak rainfall intensities of 10 to 20 mm per hour. Impact: Streams and rivers may rise rapidly. Surface flooding, slips, and difficult driving conditions possible. Chance of upgrading to a Red Warning: Low. Changes: Updated event in progress and lowered risk of upgrading to Low.

entry.title: Heavy Rain Watch
entry.summary: Periods of heavy rain, and amounts may approach warning criteria. Chance of upgrading to a Warning: Low. Changes: Updated event in progress.

entry.title: Strong Wind Watch
entry.summary: Northeast winds may approach severe gale in exposed places. Chance of upgrading to a Warning: Moderate. Changes: Warning period extended until midnight tonight (Tuesday).

author.name: Meteorological Service of New Zealand Limited

entry.title: Strong Wind Watch
entry.summary: Northeast winds may approach severe gale force in exposed places. Chance of upgrading to a Warning: Moderate. Changes: Removed Bay of Plenty east of Kawerau from watch area.

author.name: Meteorological Service of New Zealand Limited

entry.title: Strong Wind Watch
entry.summary: Northeast winds may approach severe gale force in exposed places. Chance of upgrading to a Warning: Moderate. Changes: Separated out Bay of Plenty east of Kawerau and extended period until 11am Wednesday.

entry.title: Strong Wind Watch
entry.summary: Northerly winds may approach severe gale in exposed places. Chance of upgrading to a Warning: Moderate. Changes: Extended period until 1pm Wednesday.

entry.title: Strong Wind Watch
entry.summary: North to northeast winds may approach severe gale force in exposed places. Chance of upgrading to a Warning: Moderate. Changes: Removed Taranaki from this area and extended period until 5am Wednesday.

entry.title: Severe Thunderstorm Watch
entry.summary:
Amended at 7.05am
Rain with heavy falls is expected to affect the Bay of Plenty and the far north of Gisborne during Wednesday morning, and there is a moderate risk of downpours with rainfall intensities 25 to 40 mm/h for those areas.
Rainfall of this intensity can cause surface and/or flash flooding, especially about low-lying areas such as streams, rivers or narrow valleys, and may also lead to slips. Driving conditions will also be hazardous with surface flooding and poor visibility in heavy rain.

author.name: Meteorological Service of New Zealand Limited
